thread.title: DNC Chairman Candidate Has Strong Words For Fellow Democrats
thread.title_full: DNC Chairman Candidate Has Strong Words For Fellow Democrats

author: Becky Akers
title: DNC Chairman Candidate Has Strong Words For Fellow Democrats
text:
DNC Chairman Candidate Has Strong Words For Fellow Democrats "That's not reality for most of America." by Becky Akers February 13, 2017 at 3:17pm   
If watching Democrats in action reminds you of screaming toddlers, you’re not alone. 
Raymond Buckley, chairman of New Hampshire’s Democratic Party, advised his fellow Democrats on Saturday, “ Grow up .” 
Referring to the party’s ad hominem attacks on Donald Trump during the presidential election, Buckley warned that such tactics alienate rather than convince voters: “That’s not reality for most of America.”   Clinton To Write Book About Election, Return To Paid Speaking Circuit 
“Telling the voters that, ‘Oh, our opponent is offensive,’ when you are worrying about your d— paycheck, you’re worrying about your job, you’re worrying about where you’re going to live, if your kids are ever going to school, they don’t really give a crap about if the president is an insult dog,” he said. 
“The reality is we did not offer a positive message to anyone that I’m related to. We did not offer a message to my neighbors. We did not offer a message to the people in Indiana or Ohio or Pennsylvania or Kentucky.   
“What we did is we said, ‘How offensive!'” He then added, “Grow up.” 
Buckley scolded Democrats while vying for the chairmanship of the party at the Democratic National Committee’s Future Forum in Baltimore. Yet many in his audience applauded enthusiastically. 
He amplified his criticism Monday on Fox News’ Fox & Friends , saying, “… our nominee’s campaign really did not address the economic issues that so many Americans are still suffering under. … 
“I think it is important that whoever is our nominee in 2020 that they listen to our grassroots and less to their high-paid consultants. …
